metadata.name: Bitsadmin to Uncommon TLD
metadata.comment: Detects Bitsadmin connections to domains with uncommon TLDs

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM http_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (startswith(lower(http_request.user_agent), lower('microsoft bits/')) AND NOT (endswith(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('.com')) OR endswith(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('.net')) OR endswith(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('.org')) OR endswith(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('.scdn.co')) OR endswith(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('.sfx.ms'))))

output.summary: Detects Bitsadmin connections to domains with uncommon TLDs

metadata.objective: Examine fields: ClientIP, http_request.url, http_request.user_agent False positive: Rare programs that use Bitsadmin and update from regional TLDs e.g. .uk or .ca References: https://twitter.com/jhencinski/status/1102695118455349248, https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/Investigating+Microsoft+BITS+Activity/23281/
